intro: Hibiscus odoratus, commonly known as the sweet rosinweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, and its stems are often reddish in color. Hibiscus odoratus is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like cotton and hibiscus. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and natural habitats.
